description: The department of Public Works is asking for vendors to repair wharf concealment of piers. Four pre-qualified companies choosen since Sept 20, have to submit their bids to Ariba by Dec 31. An SFSP of about $100k is expected. A site step will be done. site step will occur along Digby Shipping Facility. Vendors need acrobat format software
full_summary:
## Maritime Construction Services: Wharf Pile Repair

[English - Invitation to Qualify]

* **Publication Date**: September 28, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date**: October 12, 2023, at 14:00:00
* **Contracting Entity**: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
* **End User Entities**: Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO) / Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
* **Project Description**: This contract comprises wharf pile repair, involving the removal of existing concrete jackets and installation of new concrete protection jackets on steel H-piles. The work must be completed within 16 weeks of the contract award.
* **Estimated Cost**: Between $100,001 and $500,000
* **Pre-Qualification**: This invitation is open to pre-qualified firms who have qualified under the Invitation to Qualify process on CanadaBuys. 
* **Submission**: Proposals must be submitted via SAP Ariba no later than the closing date and time.
* **Languages**: Proposals may be submitted in either official language of Canada.

### Details for Submissions

* The estimated value of this project is between $100,001 and $500,000.
* All enquiries should be sent to the Contracting Authority using the Messages function in SAP Ariba. The deadline for enquiring is five calendar days prior to the closing date.
* A site visit is not scheduled, but it is recommended that bidders visit the site before submitting a bid.
* The selected contractor must complete the project within 16 weeks.

### Important

* This contract is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).
* The procurement method is competitive and open to all qualified bidders.
* Selection will be based on the lowest priced bid.
* Bidders should ensure that they familiarize themselves with the project requirements before submitting a proposal.

### Contact Information
* **Nicole Fesseha** (TPSGC/PSPC)
* Email: nicole.fesseha@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

I will make sure to include all relevant details so you don't incurr any losses. I also used headings to improve the stucture and readability of the text.
